meanings.definition: To oversee or direct (an activity or person)
meanings.sent1: I will supervise the class during recess.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will supervise the students during the field trip.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to supervise the dog's attempt at catching a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl seemed to supervise the forest with its keen eyes.
meanings.sent5: She always supervises the garden, making sure every plant gets enough water.

meanings.definition: To watch over and manage (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: Please supervise the children while they play in the park.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard will supervise the swimmers in the pool.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to supervise the factory production line.
meanings.sent4: The queen bee supervises the worker bees in the hive.
meanings.sent5: He carefully supervises the construction site to ensure safety measures are followed.
